title: Crypt0Gore
author: Crypt0Gore
content: I am very sure that many people do not know this, I deemed myself a poor teacher today, thanks to hossainimr93 who just opened my eye, for the past many years now I have always believe that Bitcoin.org is the official website for Bitcoin, in short, I have feed this to so many people that learn about Bitcoin through me, I feel ashamed about this, here is what he said .. Bitcoin.org was created by satoshi and is now controlled by Cøbra.Take note that even if bitcoin.org was still owned by satoshi, it wasn't the official website of bitcoin.  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5437107.msg61771381#msg61771381I know many newbies don't know this either, that is why I decide to make a topic out of this, thanks sir hossainimr93, it feels really good learning something new about Bitcoin from time to time on this forum.

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Being resourceful on many things  is good quality to have since learning more knowledge everyday is good milestone of a user since for sure they can learn more knowledge which can help them to grow as individual in cryptocurrency scene. And everybody should realize that they should never focus on how they can earn on early days of participation of this forum they should invest in knowledge because for sure once they learn all the aspects they need the earning will follow because they became skilled and maybe their contribution here will be monetized by people or company would like to reward their service provided.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: QuoteIt feels good to learn something new about Bitcoin almost every day on the forumOkay, you've learned something and there's nothing wrong with that, but how about not opening a new topic every time you have a thought or learn something new?You have been living in a delusion for years because you think there is an official site for Bitcoin, and that same Bitcoin is decentralized and has no CEO, official site, forum, central bank, spokesperson or anything similar. A small tip that is really worth a lot - when you visit a website, I advise you to read the "about" section, and then some things become much clearer

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on February 16, 2023, 12:05:25 PMQuoteIt feels good to learn something new about Bitcoin almost every day on the forumOkay, you've learned something and there's nothing wrong with that, but how about not opening a new topic every time you have a thought or learn something new?You have been living in a delusion for years because you think there is an official site for Bitcoin, and that same Bitcoin is decentralized and has no CEO, official site, forum, central bank, spokesperson or anything similar. A small tip that is really worth a lot - when you visit a website, I advise you to read the "about" section, and then some things become much clearer I thought this forum is all about learning and sharing information? How will others know this same thing? Or you are saying that I am the only stupid one that knows nothing because I couldn't read well? What about others? Are we to keep quiet whenever we learn something that others might benefit from? Since you are a legendary member then pls guide me, maybe next time I won't have to do the same. Since it doesn't matter.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on February 16, 2023, 12:21:04 PMI thought this forum is all about learning and sharing information? How will others know this same thing?Yes it is. But there are certain things that dont need to be posted as new topic. Let say you learn some new things, you could keep it to yourself since we are here to learn and also if you wanted to share its fine too as long as you use search engine to check whether the topic youve learn has been posted already by someone or not. Cause it may cause a redundancy of same topic threads.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on February 16, 2023, 11:52:28 AMI have always believe that Bitcoin.org is the official website for BitcoinKnowledge is not by assumption, the fact must be established, that's why I look upon some people once they have little clue about something they dabble into it without proper information and having the full idea of what it's all about, the more you see some falling a victim on several scam events, how possible is it that a blind man will lead his fellow blinds to the right path, being a newbie, one should learn and research and ask relevant questions.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on February 16, 2023, 12:21:04 PMI thought this forum is all about learning and sharing information?You're not wrong, a forum is a place where you can learn something, and when you learn, you can share it with someone if you think it's important. Quote from: Crypt0Gore on February 16, 2023, 12:21:04 PMHow will others know this same thing? Or you are saying that I am the only stupid one that knows nothing because I couldn't read well? What about others? Are we to keep quiet whenever we learn something that others might benefit from?I assume that most members know that this website is not an official site that represents Bitcoin, but there are certainly those who did not know that - although even in case you still live in the belief that it is an official Bitcoin site, there is no harm - because the information on that site will not mislead you or others in any way because it is under the control of good people.Quote from: Crypt0Gore on February 16, 2023, 12:21:04 PMSince you are a legendary member then pls guide me, maybe next time I won't have to do the same. Since it doesn't matter. I think I already did that, and if you didn't understand, the advice was well-intentioned. Here's another tip -> don't judge members by their rank, because there are a lot of members who have high ranks and still don't know the difference between Bitcoin and blockchain

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on February 16, 2023, 12:21:04 PMI thought this forum is all about learning and sharing information? How will others know this same thing? Or you are saying that I am the only stupid one that knows nothing because I couldn't read well? What about others? Are we to keep quiet whenever we learn something that others might benefit from? Since you are a legendary member then pls guide me, maybe next time I won't have to do the same. Since it doesn't matter. You didn't necessarily do anything wrong, it's just kinda unnecessary. People reading your last thread would've read hosseinimr93 reply about the Bitcoin.org website anyway. Also taking into consideration that the same statement has been repeated numerous times already across multiple threads.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Generally learning something new about anything gives the feeling of joy and accomplishment. The beauty about it is that if you consciously discipline yourself to learn one new thing everyday and not forget, within a very short time, you will be surprised at how much you will know. For beginner's and newbies to cryptocurrency, this is a good strategy to learn quickly, you can facilitate and make your learning time quick by challenging yourself to learn something new about bitcoins for a stipulated number of days, say a 90-days Challenge or a 100-days challenge, or any adequate number of days that you can stay committed and dedicated to learning. During the time you allocate to yourself to learn, make conscious efforts everyday to do your research and learn a new thing about bitcoins. Apart from the knowledge to gain, it will also help you in developing the culture of doing your own research.

comments.author: Arenga pinnata
comments.body: this is the official bitcoin discussion site, you don't need to hesitate to express your opinion about bitcoin or about other altcoins.all members have the right to express assumptions and voices, the most important thing is to follow the rules of the existing forum.I'm also still a beginner who doesn't have much experience, but I will always be enthusiastic to continue to explore every grain and every spark of knowledge.

comments.author: taufik123
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on February 16, 2023, 12:05:25 PM-snip-You have been living in a delusion for years because you think there is an official site for Bitcoin, and that same Bitcoin is decentralized and has no CEO, official site, forum, central bank, spokesperson or anything similar. A small tip that is really worth a lot - when you visit a website, I advise you to read the "about" section, and then some things become much clearer I also thought that it would be the official bitcoin website because at first it was created and managed by Satoshi Nakamoto, but when Satoshi came out until now the bitcoin.org website is managed together, and anyone can contribute to the website.A little tip that you care about checking the "about" section for detailed information about the website. and finally, I also know how the actual history of this bitcoin.org website is.And this forum, of course, is the main place for discussion about bitcoin and some other knowledge, nothing is more legit than this forum.https://bitcoin.org/en/about-us#ownQuote from: Crypt0Gore on February 16, 2023, 12:21:04 PM-snip- Since you are a legendary member then pls guide me, maybe next time I won't have to do the same. Since it doesn't matter. Not about legendary members, but about more knowledge. Many legendary members couldn't explain anything. Knowledge is important and regardless of rank.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on February 16, 2023, 11:52:28 AMI am very sure that many people do not know this, I deemed myself a poor teacher today, thanks to hossainimr93 who just opened my eye, for the past many years now I have always believe that Bitcoin.org is the official website for Bitcoin, in short, I have feed this to so many people that learn about Bitcoin through me, I feel ashamed about this, here is what he said .. Bitcoin.org was created by satoshi and is now controlled by Cøbra.Take note that even if bitcoin.org was still owned by satoshi, it wasn't the official website of bitcoin.  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5437107.msg61771381#msg61771381I know many newbies don't know this either, that is why I decide to make a topic out of this, thanks sir hossainimr93, it feels really good learning something new about Bitcoin from time to time on this forum. This forum is a great place to learn. And you can post here to ease the way for others to learn by using your own talent. All the members here want to learn, they deal with different things every day so if you post something informative it will be useful for others. You already understand about Bitcoin so that it will be easier for you to make decisions in the future.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: It's good that you thought it was Bitcoin.org and not Bitcoin.com, at least they don't support the so-called big blocks scam.Create one topic for all the things you have done and update it every once in a while instead of creating a new topic because we learn a lot daily, and thus you will regain others in learning instead of publishing a lot of topics that will not benefit much.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: There are cross engagement, management between Bitcointalk.org, bitcoin.org, theymos and Cøbra but they separated since April of 2020. The announcement Domain name update has more details.Both Bitcointalk.org and Bitcoin.org were created by Satoshi Nakamoto.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: OP, if you've made a discovery for yourself and in good faith decided to bring it to the attention of other newcomers, try creating a more sonorous topic name next time.Your name will not attract newcomers because it is full of topics from topic to topic. For a topic to be readable, it must be not only informative inside but also have attractive advertising.Make your topic title, posts more attractive

comments.author: Rigon
comments.body: Quote from: cryptoaddictchie on February 16, 2023, 02:24:45 PMYes it is. But there are certain things that dont need to be posted as new topic. Let say you learn some new things, you could keep it to yourself since we are here to learn and also if you wanted to share its fine too as long as you use search engine to check whether the topic youve learn has been posted already by someone or not. Cause it may cause a redundancy of same topic threads.You are right, but all human knowledge is not equal.There are some new discussions that many senior persons don't know about. As this forum is made for newbies, everyone has the right to discuss these issues here. But I would argue with your point that there are some topics that should be searched first to see if anyone has discussed them before. If no one has discussed these issues then certainly have the right to discuss these issues.
